title: Remove private from package.json
description: Removes the private field from package.json, allowing the package to be published.
body: added this by mistake

title: feat(viewer): generate circuitJsonKey from per-element bounds and refactor into util
description: Refactors the computation of circuitJsonKey in PCBViewer to use a new utility that generates a stable, content-based key from PCB element bounds and IDs, ensuring keys change only with meaningful PCB content changes.
body:
## Summary

This PR refactors how the `circuitJsonKey` is computed in `PCBViewer`.  
Instead of relying on the array length and `editCount`, we now generate a stable, content-based key using a new utility: `calculateCircuitJsonKey`.

## Changes

- Added **`lib/calculate-circuit-json-key.ts`**:
  - Computes a signature for all `pcb_` elements in the circuit JSON.
  - Uses bounding box values (rounded to 4 decimal places) and element IDs.
  - Produces a deterministic hash to ensure keys change only when PCB content meaningfully changes.
- Updated **`PCBViewer.tsx`**:
  - Replaced inline `circuitJsonKey` calculation with `useMemo(calculateCircuitJsonKey)`.
  - Ensures memoization only recomputes when `circuitJson` changes.

title: patch(global-store): set default pcb groups visibility to true

body: The default visibility of PCB groups was incorrectly set to false, which could cause confusion for users expecting to see grouped PCB elements by default. This change aligns with common user expectations and typical workflow requirements.

title: Add a center pad so that components avoid packing inside other components
description: This pull request introduces a new feature that adds a center pad to components, which helps prevent them from packing inside other components. This is achieved by modifying the buildPackedComponent function to include an optional parameter shouldAddInnerObstacles. If this parameter is set to true, an inner pad is created based on the components bounds, which is then added to the list of pads for that component. This change is expected to improve the layout and organization of components in the circuit design.
